You're about as helpful as a broken spoon in a soup fight.
You're like if WiFi had body odor.
If you were any slower, you'd be in reverse.
You're the kind of person autocorrect gives up on.

You're as useful as a screen door on a submarine.
Your brain's processing power is stuck in the floppy disk era.
You're the human equivalent of a 404 error: not found.
Your ideas are so stale, they come with an expiration date.

You're the reason calculators have an 'off' button.

You're as reliable as a weather app in a storm.
Your jokes are so bad, they make dad jokes look like comedy gold.
You're the reason we can't have nice things, like functioning group chats.

Your charisma is so low, it’s measured in negative decibels.
